question: 織物
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>thing</kanji>s that are <kanji>weave</kanji>d are, essentially, just <vocabulary>cloth</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>fabric</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The readings are the kun'yomi readings. With <ja>織</ja> you can pull the reading from <ja>織る</ja>. With <ja>物</ja> you've probably seen it enough to know that it's often <ja>もの</ja> and not <ja>ぶつ</ja>. Just think of a piece of <vocabulary>cloth</vocabulary> that is <reading>mono</reading>chrome.
